meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>opposite</kanji> so the verb version is <vocabulary>to oppose</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to go against</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

Just like when you play <reading>soccer</reading> (さか). You never play right, causing you <vocabulary>to go against</vocabulary> all things you're supposed to do and shoot goals into your own goalie's net.
